newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Colombia Q1 industrial output down - private report.
newsitem.headline: Colombia Q1 industrial output down - private report.

text.p: Colombia's industrial sector showed few signs of emerging from recession in the first quarter, according to a report released Tuesday by the country's leading organization of private industry.
Production of manufactured goods fell by 3.3 percent in the first quarter, with sales dropping an average 1.4 percent, the National Industrialists Association reported.
"These numbers are disastrous when you consider that they are compared with a very bad trimester last year," the association's president, Luis Carlos Villegas, said at a news conference.
Villegas said metal output, which had shown signs of recuperation, dropped by 2.8 percent.
Textile production fell by 10.6 percent, with sales falling 5.9 percent. Cement and non-metallic mineral production fell 15.5 percent, with sales down 13.2 percent.
Production of paper and glass-related products showed significant improvement, though those sectors are not likely provide the economic boost Colombia needs, Villegas said.
Some of the drop in production may reflect adjustments by manufacturers that perceive a further slackening of demand, he said.

Falling demand, a thriving black market and political instability are the chief concerns of Colombian industrialists according to the report, which was based on results of a recent survey by the association.
